subject: Public Speaking
title: First Draft Is Always Bad
description: A 60-second lesson on First Draft Is Always Bad.

hook.text: First drafts are terrible. Accept this. Revise relentlessly.

discovery.text: First pass: cut inefficiency. Second: tighten. Third: improve flow.

twist.text: Each revision cuts 10-20% of words. The speech gets tighter.

climax.text: By revision five, the speech has found its voice.

punchline.text: Revision makes writing great. Accept the grind.

quiz.question: How many revisions do pros do?
